Article Title: Irked by rally, Supreme Court threatens to cancel bail
Article Text:
Times View It has happened in the past that politicians accused of serious crimes have celebrated the occasion of being given bail like an acquittal. The apex court has rightly warned against over the top displays on such occasions.

NEW DELHI: Politicians , imprisoned for alleged crimes, are typically greeted by unruly celebrations by their supporters when they get bail, leading to inconvenience to the public. In what could be a cautionary tale for them, SC Tuesday took a serious view of the practice and threatened to cancel the bail it had granted to an alleged criminal of Maharashtra's Newasa for taking out a motorcade and getting showered with flowers by a JCB machine.Sopan Gade of Newasa faced several criminal cases, including a murder case of 2013. His bail plea in the murder case was rejected by trial court and Bombay HC bench at Aurangabad considering his criminal antecedents, absconding during pendency of trial and tactics to delay trial.On Tuesday, the complainant in the case, which related to murder of advocate Riyaz Pathan, complained before a bench of Justices B R Gavai and K V Viswanathan that days after SC granted bail considering that he has undergone almost a decade of incarceration, the accused roamed around Newasa town in a huge motorcade apparently to terrorise witnesses.Seeking cancellation of Sopan Gade's bail, complainant Asif Khan told SC that "On Dec 16 last year, to create his fear among the people, Sopan organised a rally in his four-wheeler accompanied by 100 to 150 four-wheelers and 70 to 80 two-wheelers. It was telecast live on social media. They burst crackers, showered flowers from JCB to felicitate the accused. The motorcade caused a traffic jam on the NH for five to six hours."The bench was furious and said it has become a habit with leaders to go around the town with supporters in a rally after getting bail. When Sopan's counsel said his supporters arranged the rally, the bench said, "You file an apology for going in a motorcade and organising a rally. You also file an undertaking that you will never indulge in any such activities in future."
Article Summary: Sopan Gade of Newasa faced several criminal cases, including a murder case of 2013. His bail plea in the murder case was rejected by trial court and Bombay HC bench at Aurangabad. The bench was furious and said it has become a habit with leaders to go around the town with supporters in a rally after getting bail. They burst crackers, showered flowers from JCB to felicitate the accused.

Article Title: Kolkata doctor rape-murder case: CBI takes over, key doctors' body ends strike -Top developments
Article Text:
Details of the crime

Arrest of Sanjay Ray

What did the autopsy reveal

Controversy over principal's reappointment

NHRC takes suo moto cognisance

HC tells doctors to call off strike

JP Nadda meets IMA chief

CBI takes over

Doctors' body calls off strike

NEW DELHI: Following the Calcutta high court's order, the Central Bureau of Investigation took over the RG Kar Medical College rape-murder case to the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Tuesday. This case has placed significant scrutiny on the Mamata Banerjee-led government after a postgraduate trainee doctor was raped and murdered by a volunteer police worker.The agency promptly completed all necessary formalities within hours of the Calcutta High Court's order instructing the state police to transfer the case documents to the central probe agency.Meanwhile, Federation of resident doctors' association called off its strike after meeting Union minister JP Nadda.The controversy began when the victim's family revealed to the Metro that the hospital initially attempted to downplay the incident. The opposition criticised the Mamata government for forming an 11-member panel, which included interns, to investigate the case.Although Sanjay Ray was arrested with evidence and DNA tests linking him to the crime scene, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has accused the West Bengal police of mishandling the investigationInvestigative details indicate that after committing the crime, Sanjay Ray returned to police barracks to sleep. Allegedly, Ray had unrestricted access to various rooms and wards in the hospital.The incident occurred after the victim and four colleagues shared a meal in the seminar room while watching the Olympics. Her colleagues left, and she remained in the room to study. At 3am, she was last seen asleep. Around 4am, the accused allegedly entered, sexually assaulted her, and strangled her when she resisted. Her body was discovered at 7.30am.Sanjay Ray, a civic volunteer with the Kolkata Police , was arrested on Saturday just six hours after a seven-member Special Investigation Team ( SIT ) was formed by the police force to investigate the case.On Sunday, the most damning evidence against Sanjay Ray, the primary suspect in the rape and murder of the 31-year-old doctor, was uncovered by investigators."Traces of blood and skin found under the victim's fingernails perfectly matched Ray's DNA and corresponded to the injuries he sustained during the attack," a senior police officer stated. This evidence strongly links Ray to the heinous crime.The report concluded that the cause of death was smothering and throttling. The initial findings suggest that the victim died as a result of gagging, and there were numerous indications of injuries and struggle on the body. "The mouth and throat were constantly pressed to prevent screaming."Sanjay strangled the victim's throat to suffocate them, resulting in the fracture of the thyroid cartilage. The victim's face and eyes were stained with blood, and scratch marks were present on various parts of the body. Additionally, there was evidence of bleeding from the private parts, further indicating the violent nature of the attack.The Calcutta high court has directed Sandip Ghosh, the former principal of RG Kar Medical College, to submit a leave application by Tuesday at 3pm. Ghosh's appointment as the principal of Calcutta National Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata, which came immediately after his resignation, sparked protests."How can the principal - who resigned by taking moral responsibility, be appointed as the principal of another government college? The court has asked him to submit a leave application by 3pm today or the court will pass an order for him to leave the position," the court observed."Why are you protecting him? Record his statement. Let him tell whatever he knows," the court asked.The National Human Rights Commission on Tuesday took suo moto cognisance of the case. The commission observed that the contents of the media report, if true, raise a serious issue of violation of human rights of the victim. In response to the gravity of the situation, the commission has issued formal notices to the chief secretary and the director general of Police of West Bengal, requesting a comprehensive report on the incident within a period of two weeks.Representatives from the National Commission for Women went to the location where the crime occurred and spoke with the investigators and the victim's family members. The NCW strongly condemned the incident, describing it as "heinous," and demanded that justice be served.In its direction to transfer the case to the CBI the Calcutta high court also urged the agitating doctors to call off their strike saying that they have a "pious obligation".Demonstrations broke out in various parts of India, with medical professionals calling for a thorough inquiry by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) into recent incidents. Doctors at AIIMS Delhi, as well as hospitals in Mumbai and Nagpur, participated in the protests, urging authorities to take action and ensure better security measures for healthcare workers.The Federation of Resident Doctors' Association has resolved to continue its current indefinite strike after a fruitless discussion with officials from the Union health ministry in New Delhi.Union health minister JP Nadda met with the national president of the Indian Medical Association (IMA) Dr R V Asokan.This came after the IMA expressed their shock and dismay in a letter addressed to Nadda, and put forth five demands:The IMA urged the government to declare hospitals as safe zones and define the entitlement of this term in the law. They also called for the establishment of police camps and adequate security personnel in all major government hospitals, with similar arrangements being made mandatory in large private hospitals. The association emphasized the need for compulsory installation of CCTV cameras at vulnerable points within healthcare facilities.The Central Bureau of Investigation has taken over the investigation into the incident. The agency promptly completed all necessary formalities within hours of the Calcutta High Court's order instructing the state police to transfer the case documents to the central probe agency.On Wednesday early morning, a team of CBI officials from Delhi, accompanied by forensic scientists and medical experts, will visit Kolkata.The federation of resident doctors association (Forda) also met Union health minister JP Nadda and called off the protests after getting assurance of free and fair trail of the matter.
Article Summary: The Central Bureau of Investigation took over the RG Kar Medical College rape- murder case. The case has placed significant scrutiny on the Mamata Banerjee-led government. Postgraduate trainee doctor was raped and murdered by a volunteer police worker. The opposition criticised the government for forming an 11-member panel to investigate.

Article Title: 'We don't comment on ... ': What EAM Jaishankar said on US elections result
Article Text: NEW DELHI: As the election race heats up in US, India's external affair minister weighed in and reiterated that New Delhi is prepared to work with Washington , regardless of who reaches the oval office.Referring to last 2o years of relationship between the two democracies, the EAM said, "We have every confidence that we will be able to work with the president of the United States, whoever he or she will be.""Generally, we don't comment on other people's elections because we also hope others don't comment on us.But the American system will throw up its verdict. And, I'm not saying this just as a formality, but if you look over the last 20-odd years, maybe a little bit more for us, we have every confidence that we will be able to work with the president of the United States, whoever he or she will be," the EAM said at the launch of Indian diaspora's impact report in Delhi."I'm an optimistic person and generally tend to think of solutions to problems rather than the problems that come out of solutions," he said, adding that the world is going through a "exceptionally difficult period".He added that it would be a very grim forecast for the next five years.The foreign minister also referred to the Russia-Ukraine and the Israel- Hamas war, which has shown no signs of dying down."You have what you see happening in the Middle East, what you see happening in Ukraine, what you see happening in Southeast Asia, East Asia, the continued impact of the COVID which those of us who have come out of it take for granted, but many have not come out of it," the EAM said.Further pointing at the economic challenges worldwide, EAM said that many countries are struggling today."The kind of economic challenges which you see in the world, you see more and more countries struggling. You know, their trade is getting difficult, facing foreign exchange shortages, so, you know, disruptions of various kinds," he said.Jaishankar further went on and mentioned that in today' s world, climate events are also globally causing disruptive consequences."What was happening in the Red Sea, climate events which are no longer just news. I mean, they have globally disruptive consequences, and sometimes entire regions of countries being basically made dysfunctional," he said.
Article Summary: India's external affair minister reiterated that New Delhi is prepared to work with Washington, regardless of who reaches the oval office. Jaishankar said that the world is going through a "exceptionally difficult period" He added that it would be a very grim forecast for the next five years.

Article Title: Northern Army Commander visits Doda-Kishtwar, reviews anti-terror ops in Chenab region
Article Text: JAMMU: Ahead of Independence Day, General Officer Commanding-in-Chief (GOC-in-C) Lt Gen MV Suchindra Kumar visited forward locations of Counter Insurgency Force (Delta) in J&K’s Doda and Kishtwar districts Tuesday and exhorted officers of all ranks to maintain the tempo of anti-terror operations to ensure security of ongoing and upcoming national events in the region.In light of increased terrorist activity, Lt Gen Kumar reviewed the ongoing anti-terror operations in Chenab region . He also assessed options for deploying additional forces being inducted into the area and stressed on Army’s synergy with J&K Police and paramilitary forces, a Northern Command spokesperson said.Security forces have been combing the interiors of Jammu division following a spurt in terrorist violence since June 9 when an ambush on a pilgrim bus in Reasi district left nine people dead. Security forces lost 11 men — 10 soldiers and one CRPF head constable — in subsequent attacks in Kathua and Doda districts. On July 10, terrorists attacked a police picket in Basantgarh and fled. Earlier, a village defence guard named M Sharif was killed during a gunfight between security forces and terrorists in Panara village of Basantgarh on April 28.The Udhampur-Samba-Kathua region, sharing a border and characterised by thick forests and mountainous terrain, provide terrorists with ample cover to evade detection. Terrorists crossing the Pakistan border had been known to use the Bani-Basantgarh route from Kathua as a conduit to enter Doda and then proceed to Kashmir valley.
Article Summary: Lt Gen MV Suchindra Kumar visited forward locations of Counter Insurgency Force (Delta) in J&K’s Doda and Kishtwar districts. Security forces have been combing the interiors of Jammu division following a spurt in terrorist violence.

Article Title: Scheduled Castes: VCK up against sub-categorisation of SC by states
Article Text: CHENNAI: VCK leader Thol Thirumavalavan on Tuesday led a protest against Supreme Court verdict that permits states to create sub-categorization among Scheduled Castes for reservation . The party opposed court's suggestion to exclude the creamy layer among Scheduled Castes from the quota system.Expressing concerns that giving states power could lead to arbitrary decisions, Thirumavalavan said issues affecting Dalits should be addressed solely by Parliament .“If it is handed over to the state, they will exclude anyone and include anyone in the SC list. They will disintegrate the community in future. The community which accounts for 35% of the total population in the country will never emerge as a political force,” Thirumavalavan said. He alleged that the previous AIADMK regime extended the vanniyar quota for political gains without consulting other parties and the court struck it down later.Thirumavalavan demanded clarity from Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the govt’s stance regarding exclusion of creamy layer from reservations.
Article Summary: VCK leader Thol Thirumavalavan led a protest against Supreme Court verdict that permits states to create sub-categorization among Scheduled Castes for reservation. The party opposed court's suggestion to exclude the creamy layer from the quota system.

Article Title: Murder: Bilaspur court sentences man to death for murdering wife and three minor children in 'rarest of rare' case
Article Text: RAIPUR: The trial court of Bilaspur has convicted 34-year-old Umend Kevat for the murder of his wife and three minor children , including his 18-month-old son Pawan Kevat, under Section 302 of the Indian Penal Code , and has pronounced the death penalty for the accused, considering the case as one of the rarest of the rare. Suspecting his wife's character, the accused strangled Sukrita Kevat, 32, along with their daughters Khushi Kevat, 5, Lisa Kevat, 3, and son Pawan Kevat on January 1, 2024.“Given the severity of the crime, the accused's behavior does not warrant any leniency.The act of murdering his helpless wife and children in such a brutal manner makes this case one of the ' rarest of rare ' cases, which justifies the imposition of the death penalty,” the trial court stated.The tenth Additional Sessions Judge, Bilaspur, Avinash K Tripathi, said, “The court is of the view that a witness may lie, but circumstances do not. Circumstantial evidence forms the basis of rules and law. The accused, in this case, is solely responsible for the crime from which he cannot escape. The saying 'Actions Speak Louder Than Words' applies aptly to this case. The only conclusion is that no one else has committed the crime other than the accused, Umend Kevat.”Citing Supreme Court judgments in similar cases and the circumstances of this case, the court ruled that the accused's act of killing his family was nothing less than inhumane. The victims, including the children, were innocent and helpless. After a premeditated plan, the accused killed his wife and children one by one by strangling them with a rope, likely driven by doubts about his wife’s character.The accused first took his wife outside under the pretext of some work, strangled her from behind with a rope, and then returned to the room to kill his three children. This indicates that the accused was fully aware of his actions and their consequences. The manner in which these murders were carried out reflects a calculated and deliberate plan, leaving no room for doubt that this was an exceptionally heinous crime, the trial court noted.After thoroughly examining all the circumstances and arguments presented, the court rejected the plea for leniency and sentenced the accused to death under Section 302 of the Indian Penal Code, along with a fine of Rs 10,000. The court also ordered that the accused be hanged by the neck until death. This death sentence will remain subject to confirmation by the High Court as per Section 366 of the Code of Criminal Procedure.The trial court also observed that the impact of these murders is especially devastating for the surviving family members, particularly the elderly grandparents, whose only surviving relatives have now been taken from them. Given these circumstances, the court found no reason to show any leniency, concluding that Umend Kevat’s actions warrant the death penalty, which is in the best interest of society.
Article Summary: Umend Kevat, 34, convicted of murdering his wife and three minor children, including his 18-month-old son Pawan Kevat. Suspecting his wife's character, the accused strangled Sukrita Kevat along with their daughters Khushi, 5, Lisa, 3, and Pawan, on January 1, 2024.

Article Title: Chhattisgarh: Chhattisgarh: Six students injured as classroom ceiling plaster caves in govt school
Article Text: RAIPUR : At least six children of Class VI were wounded when a huge plaster of the classroom ceiling collapsed when the students were sitting in class, at a govt school in Janjgir Champa district in Chhattisgarh on Tuesday.Amid several incidents of portions of school walls or ceilings collapsing and leaving students injured , the incident took place on Tuesday morning at the village Putpura govt school.The students were sitting in class when a plaster from the ceiling caved in.One girl sustained severe injuries to her head, and five others, including one boy, were also wounded. There was chaos for a moment, and the students were rescued and rushed to the hospital. They were provided with primary treatment and admitted to the hospital. Their condition is stated to be stable.The students and parents are in shock and are demanding an explanation followed by action in the matter. The parents said they will not be able to send their children to school until the building is repaired.The school management said that they have been asking for repairs or a new premise for the school for a long time, as the building is in a dilapidated condition and it becomes risky during incessant rainfall.A teacher said that it was only yesterday that a proposal was approved for demolition of the building and a new premises should be constructed.TOI tried calling District Education Officer Ashwani Bhardwaj, but he wasn’t available for comments.District collector Akash Chikara visited the hospital to meet students.
Article Summary: The incident took place on Tuesday morning at the village Putpura govt school. The students were sitting in class when a plaster from the ceiling caved in. One girl sustained severe injuries to her head, and five others, including one boy, were also wounded.

Article Title: CBI takes over investigation into Kolkata doctor's rape-murder case after HC order
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Central Bureau of Investigation ( CBI ) has taken over the investigation on Tuesday into the rape and murder of a woman doctor at a state-run medical college in Kolkata, as per officials.The agency promptly completed all necessary formalities within hours of the Calcutta High Court 's order instructing the state police to transfer the case documents to the central probe agency.On Wednesday early morning, a team of CBI officials from Delhi, accompanied by forensic scientists and medical experts, will visit Kolkata. The High Court had earlier directed the state police to hand over the case diary to the CBI by 10 AM on Wednesday.The postgraduate trainee's body was discovered on Friday morning inside a seminar hall of the state-run RG Kar hospital, where she was allegedly raped and murdered. A civic volunteer was arrested in connection with the case on Saturday. The preliminary autopsy report indicated that the victim had been sexually abused and murdered, with injuries observed on her eyes, mouth, private parts, left leg, neck, right hand, ring finger, and lips.The Kolkata Police had arrested a 33-year-old individual who joined the force as a civic volunteer in 2019. The police alleged that the accused was married at least four times and was known as a "womaniser". The accused, a trained boxer, had developed close relationships with a few senior police officers over the years, leading to his transfer to the Kolkata Police Welfare Board and posting at the police outpost at the state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital, where the incident occurred.
Article Summary: The CBI completed all necessary formalities within hours of the Calcutta High Court's order instructing the state police to transfer the case documents to the central probe agency. The postgraduate trainee's body was discovered on Friday morning inside a seminar hall of the state-run RG Kar hospital. A civic volunteer was arrested in connection with the case on Saturday.

Article Title: Doctors: Kolkata doctor's rape-murder: Doctors’ anger continues to rage on campuses & beyond
Article Text: KOLKATA: Anger continues to rage on medical campuses across Kolkata, districts and beyond. Sandip Ghosh’s resignation from the post of principal at R G Kar Medical College did not break ice with the protesting resident doctors , interns and house staff. In fact, they have decided to intensify their agitation as they are not convinced with the course of investigation in the rape and murder of a second-year PGT doctor.Medical college campuses in Bengal have been on unrest since Friday after news of the PGT doctor’s gruesome rape and murder spread like wildfire across the country.The protest that began on the R G Kar campus was soon replicated by junior doctors across the country.“Our demand was not only for the resignation of the incumbent principal Sandip Ghosh but also that he does not occupy any administration post in any medical college. But he was appointed the principal of CNMC hours after his resignation. Our protest will be on until all our demands are met,” said a PGT doctor at R G Kar Medical College.Students and junior doctors from different medical colleges, including IPGMER, Medical College, CNMC and NRS, marched to R G Kar Medical College on Monday evening. A general body meeting was being held till late into the night chalking out the next course of action.“There were promises of beefing up security after the Paribaha Mukherjee incident at NRS Medical College. Now a PGT gets raped and murdered in the very hospital she was on duty. Where is our security? We will not rest this time till we are convinced about the security measures,” said a junior doctor at R G Kar Medical College.Even as the health department has cancelled leaves of senior faculty members and posted them in OPD and emergency duties, the absence of junior doctors is affecting hospital services.The Resident Doctors’ Association (RDA) of AIIMS Delhi joined the Federation of Resident Doctors’ Association (FORDA) in its nation-wide strike on Monday morning, suspending all elective and non-essential services, including OPDs and patient wards.Ten govt hospitals in Delhi have begun an indefinite strike, halting all elective services on Monday. Maulana Azad Medical College, RML Hospital, Lady Hardinge Medical College, VMMC and Safdarjung Hospital, Deen Dayal Upadhyay Hospital, GTB, IHBAS, Dr Baba Saheb Ambedkar Medical College and National Institute of TB and Respiratory Diseases Hospital are participating in the strike, which began at 9 am.Resident doctors of the Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research (PGIMER) Chandigarh on Monday held a protest.Hundreds of resident doctors on Monday suspended their regular work and staged a peaceful rally in Jammu. Resident doctors in Maharashtra announced an indefinite strike from Tuesday.
Article Summary: Students and junior doctors from different medical colleges, including IPGMER, Medical College, CNMC and NRS, marched to R G Kar Medical College on Monday evening. Resident Doctors’ Association (RDA) of AIIMS Delhi joined the Federation of Resident Doctors' Association (FORDA) in its nation-wide strike on Monday morning.

Article Title: 'Her moment': Time magazine unveils latest edition with Kamala Harris on cover page
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The course of the US presidential election has changed a lot in the past 2 months. It all started with President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump 's debate which was called a disaster.The sudden assassination attack on Trump by a 20-year-old kitchen worker. Later on, Biden withdrew from the race and quickly endorsed Kamala Harris for the presidency.Harris’s campaign raised $81 million within 24 hours of the announcement. Last week, she introduced Minnesota Governor Tim Walz as her running mate, earning widespread praise on social media, where many embraced his nickname, “Coach Walz.”Harris is now leading Trump in four key battleground states, including Wisconsin, Pennsylvania, and Michigan, with a four-point advantage—an improvement over Biden’s earlier polling numbers.Trump campaign officials dismissed the latest poll, conducted by The New York Times and Siena College, claiming it “dramatically understated” Trump’s support. According to a memo obtained by Newsweek, the campaign argued that these public surveys were deliberately intended to suppress enthusiasm for Trump.Over the weekend, Trump reinforced this narrative on Truth Social, stating, “I’m doing really well in the presidential race, leading in almost all of the REAL polls, despite the Democrats’ unprecedented move to change their primary candidate. I did great in 2016 and WON, did much better in 2020, getting many millions more votes than in ‘16, but this 2024 campaign is shaping up to be my best yet.”
Article Summary: The course of the US presidential election has changed a lot in the past 2 months. It all started with President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump's debate which was called a disaster. Later on, Biden withdrew from the race and quickly endorsed Kamala Harris for the presidency.

Article Title: Barron Trump: Barron Trump's 'best friend' says Donald asked him 5 times if...

?

Article Title: All are equal, will protect your rights, Yunus assures Hindus
Article Text: DHAKA: Unrest-scarred Hindus in Bangladesh are entitled to the same rights as other citizens and the interim govt will do whatever it takes to safeguard them, chief adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus said Tuesday in his first outreach to the minority community amid a wave of attacks on the sidelines of the student-led agitation that triggered the regime change.“Do not make distinctions among us. Exercise patience and judge us later — what we were able to do and what we couldn't. If we fail, criticise us,” Yunus told representatives of the community at the Bangladesh capital’s landmark Dhakeshwari temple.The Nobel laureate also spoke of the need to fix “all that is rotten in the country’s institutional mechanisms”.“I am here to say we are all equal...In our democratic aspirations, we should not be seen as Muslims, Hindus, or Buddhists, but as human beings...The root of all problems lies in institutional decay,” he said.Reiterating what he said at Dhaka airport on his arrival from Paris for the Aug 8 swearing-in of the interim govt, Yunus said it was his mission to create a Bangladesh that would live "as a family in which there is no place for conflict and discrimination".Law adviser Dr Asif Nazrul and religious affairs adviser AFM Khalid Hossain accompanied Yunus to the shrine.His remarks coincided with the Bangladesh National Hindu Grand Alliance, the country's largest organisation representing the community, that Hindus faced attacks and intimidation at 278 locations across 48 districts since the fall of the erstwhile Sheikh Hasina govt on Aug 5."This is an assault on the Hindu religion. We, too, have rights in this country. We were born here," PTI quoted the organisation's spokesperson Palash Kanti Dey as saying."The incidents of vandalism, looting, arson, land grab, and threats to leave the country have been repeatedly inflicted on the Hindu community due to the shifting political landscape," he said.Thousands of Hindus have descended on the streets over the past few days to demand safety and security to live and work in the country of their birth.The interim govt Monday set up a hotline asking people to provide information about attacks on Hindu temples, churches or any other religious institutions.
Article Summary: Nobel laureate Prof Muhammad Yunus spoke of the need to fix “all that is rotten in the country’s institutional mechanisms’ Yunus said it was his mission to create a Bangladesh that would live "as a family in which there is no place for conflict and discrimination"

Article Title: Russia 'pauses' Ukraine's incursion; Kyiv says 74 areas in its control, but occupation not the goal
Article Text: KYIV: Russia said Tuesday that its forces checked an effort by Ukrainian troops to expand a stunning weeklong incursion into the Kursk region , as a Ukrainian foreign ministry spokesman said Kyiv has no intention of occupying Russian territory. Russian army units, including fresh reserves, aircraft, drone teams and artillery forces, stopped Ukrainian armoured mobile groups from moving deeper into Russia near the Kursk settlements of Obshchy Kolodez, Snagost, Kauchuk and Alexeyevsky, a Russian defence ministry statement said.Meanwhile, Ukrainian foreign ministry spokesman Heorhii Tykhyi said the cross-border operation was aimed at protecting Ukrainian land from long-range strikes launched from Kursk."Ukraine is not interested in taking the territory of the Kursk region, but we want to protect the lives of our people," he said, adding that Russia had launched over 2,000 strikes from the Kursk region in recent months. The commander of the Ukrainian military, Oleksandr Syrskyi, said Ukraine now controls 74 settlements in Kursk region. "Ukrainian troops have continued to advance, gaining control over 40sqkm of territory in the past 24 hours."
Article Summary: Russian army units, including fresh reserves, aircraft, drone teams and artillery forces stopped Ukrainian armoured mobile groups from moving deeper into Russia. Ukrainian foreign ministry spokesman Heorhii Tykhyi said the cross- border operation was aimed at protecting Ukrainian land from long-range strikes launched from Kursk.

Article Title: Study shows presence of 10 tigers and 46 leopards in Western Ghats
Article Text:
Keri:

A study conducted by the Wildlife Conservation Trust (WCT), in association with the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve and the forest of territorial circle of Kolhapur, has shown the presence of eight adult tigers , two cubs, 46 leopards and nine dhole packs in the Western Ghats .The corridor between the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve and newly declared Conservation Reserves of Maharashtra to the Kali Tiger Reserve of Karnataka, shares borders with the Mhadei, Mahavir, Netravali and Cotigao Wildlife Sanctuaries and the Mollem National Park of Goa, and the Bhimgad Wildlife Sanctuary.The study also assessed the first ever density estimates for tigers and leopards in the Conservation Reserves of Maharashtra and the relative abundance indices for wild prey species of gaur and sambar.The study has identified bottlenecks, crossing points and gaps for wild mammals along with the state and national highways passing through the conservation reserves and adjoining forests. It also highlighted the need of implementing mitigation measures, if expansion of these highways is undertaken. It has also set a baseline, which is vital to assess the impact of management actions or landscape change.“The corridor from the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve to the Kali Tiger Reserve is the only corridor that can allow movement of wildlife, including tigers to cross the landscape and plays key role in repopulating tigers in the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve,” said R M Ramanujan, principal conservation of forests (territory), Kolhapur, in the report.WCT president Anish Andhera said, “Protecting and monitoring the tiger corridor between Sahyadri and Kali Tiger Reserves are pivotal in improving the status of the tigers and other large mammals in this vast, multiple use landscape.”Wildlifer Girish Punjabi said, “Our collaborative research highlights why corridor connectivity is so crucial for large carnivores, especially for the tiger and sloth bear. With nearly 10 tigers in the Maharashtra corridor, and the connected tiger population of the Kali Tiger Reserve and the protected areas in Goa, we should see gradual colonisation by tigers up to the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve, which is located further north.”In the case of sloth bears, there are almost no bears in the corridor between Radhanagari Wildlife Sanctuary and Chandoli National Park, despite both the protected areas having reasonable populations. Therefore, any human development pressures in the corridor need to be minimised.”
Article Summary: Eight adult tigers, two cubs, 46 leopards and nine dhole packs in the Western Ghats. Study has identified bottlenecks, crossing points and gaps for wild mammals along with the state and national highways passing through the conservation reserves and adjoining forests. It also highlighted the need of implementing mitigation measures, if expansion of these highways is undertaken.

Article Title: 'I want justice ... ': Sheikh Hasina's first statement after ouster as Bangladesh PM
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina issued her first statement since stepping down from her position on Tuesday, calling for accountability for those responsible for recent violence and vandalism during student protests against government job quotas.In a statement released through her son, Sajeeb Wazed, Hasina remarked, "The Father of the Nation Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman , under whose leadership we have gained self-esteem as an independent nation, got self-identity and got an independent country, has been grossly insulted.They insulted the blood of millions of martyrs. I want justice from the countrymen," she said.Hasina continued, “Since July, the violence, arson, and terrorism disguised as protests have claimed many innocent lives. I express my condolences and prayers for the victims, including students, teachers, police officers, a pregnant policewoman, journalists, cultural workers, professionals, Awami League members and their affiliates, pedestrians, and those working in various institutions who have suffered from this terror.”“I offer my sympathy to those who, like me, are grieving the loss of loved ones. I call for a thorough investigation into these acts of murder and terrorism, and for the perpetrators to be identified and punished accordingly,” she added.Hasina also urged the people of Bangladesh to observe National Mourning Day on August 15 in honor of Sheikh Mujibur Rahman’s assassination anniversary.“I ask you to mark August 15 with appropriate solemnity and respect. Please lay floral tributes and offer prayers at Bangabandhu Bhaban, and remember the souls of all the martyrs,” she said.Meanwhile, Prof Muhammad Yunus led interim government announced after a meeting that there would be no national holiday on August 15, the Daily Star reported."The decision to cancel the national holiday on August 15 was taken unanimously after a discussion with the council of advisers and political parties," said a press release sent from the Chief Adviser's Office.
Article Summary: Sheikh Hasina issued her first statement since stepping down from her position on Tuesday. She called for accountability for those responsible for recent violence and vandalism during student protests against government job quotas. Hasina also urged the people of Bangladesh to observe National Mourning Day on August 15 in honor of Sheikh Mujibur Rahman’s assassination anniversary.

Article Title: Japan's Kishida tells his ruling party he will not run in its September leadership vote, NHK says
Article Text: TOKYO: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has notified his governing party executives that he will not run in the upcoming party leadership vote in September, meaning Japan will have a new prime minister, Japan's NHK public television and other media reported.Kishida was elected president of his governing Liberal Democratic Party in 2021 and his three-year term expires in September.His drop out of the race means a new leader who wins the party vote will succeed him as prime minister because the LDP controls both houses of parliament.Kishida, stung by his party's corruption scandals, has suffered dwindling support ratings that have dipped below 20%.Kishida was set to explain his decision in a press conference later Monday.Local election losses earlier in the year eroded his clout, and LDP lawmakers have voiced the need for a fresh face ahead of the next general election.Since the corruption scandal broke, Kishida has removed a number of Cabinet ministers and others from party executive posts, dissolved party factions that were criticized as the source of money-for-favor politics, and passed a law tightening political funds control law. But support for his government has dwindled.The scandal centers on unreported political funds raised through tickets sold for party events. It involved more than 80 LDP lawmakers, mostly belonging to a major party faction previously led by assassinated former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe. Ten people - lawmakers and their aides - were indicted in January.
Article Summary: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has notified his governing party executives that he will not run in the upcoming party leadership vote in September. His drop out of the race means a new leader who wins the party vote will succeed him as prime minister because the LDP controls both houses of parliament.

Article Title: Israel Weapons Sale: US approves $20 billion weapons sale to Israel despite rights activists' concerns
Article Text: The Biden administration approved more than $20 billion package for new weapons sales to Israel, defying the pressure from rights activists to halt arms deliveries due to the death toll in Gaza. The weapons delivery will take years to complete.In a notification to Congress, the state department announced the approval of a sale consisting of 50 F-15 fighter jets to Israel for $18.82 billion.Along with the jets, Israel will purchase nearly 33,000 tank cartridges, up to 50,000 explosive mortar cartridges, and new military cargo vehicles. The F-15 jets, equipped with advanced radar and secure communications gear, will significantly upgrade Israel's existing fleet when they begin arriving in 2029."The United States is committed to the security of Israel, and it is vital to US national interests to assist Israel to develop and maintain a strong and ready self-defence capability," the state department stated in its notice on the F-15s, which Boeing produces.Regarding the tank cartridges, the United States emphasised that the sale "will improve Israel's capability to meet current and future enemy threats, strengthen its homeland defence, and serve as a deterrent to regional threats."Congress retains the authority to block weapons sales, but doing so is challenging. Human rights groups and some progressive members of Biden's Democratic Party have urged the administration to halt arms sales to Israel, condemning the high number of civilian casualties in the Gaza conflict . Josh Paul, who resigned from the state department last year over Gaza policy, criticised Israel's actions."Authorizing billions of dollars in new arms transfers effectively provides Israel a carte blanche to continue its atrocities in Gaza and to escalate the conflict to Lebanon," said Paul, who now works at the Middle East rights group, Dawn.Recently, rescuers in Gaza, controlled by Hamas , reported that 93 people were killed in an Israeli airstrike on a school housing displaced Palestinians. Israel claimed it was targeting militants at the school. While Biden administration officials expressed concern over civilian deaths, they did not comment on whether US-supplied weapons were used in the strike.Earlier in May, Biden paused a shipment to Israel that included 2,000-pound bombs and cautioned against a large-scale assault on Rafah in southern Gaza, where many displaced Palestinians reside.However, the administration has not halted other weapons deliveries and dismissed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s complaints in June that the US was delaying shipments.The Gaza war initiated on October 7, when Hamas launched an attack on southern Israel, resulting in the deaths of 1,198 people, predominantly civilians, as per an AFP tally of Israeli official figures. Militants also captured 251 individuals, with 111 still held captive in Gaza, including 39 whom the military reports are deceased.Israel’s military response in Gaza has led to at least 39,929 deaths, according to the territory's health ministry, though the statistics do not specify the number of civilians versus militants killed.In a recent address to Congress, which was boycotted by numerous Democrats, Netanyahu urged the US to expedite military aid, arguing that it would "dramatically expedite an end to the war in Gaza."
Article Summary: 50 F-15 fighter jets, 33,000 tank cartridges, up to 50,000 explosive mortar cartridges, and new military cargo vehicles will be delivered to Israel in 2029. Human rights groups and some progressive members of Biden's Democratic Party have urged the administration to halt arms sales to Israel.

Article Title: Only Gaza ceasefire can delay Iran response to killing of Hamas chief by Israel: Report
Article Text: DUBAI/BEIRUT: Only a ceasefire deal in Gaza stemming from hoped-for talks this week would hold Iran back from direct retaliation against Israel for the assassination of Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh on its soil, three Iranian officials said.Iran has vowed a severe response to Haniyeh's killing, which it blamed on Israel. Israel has neither confirmed or denied its involvement.The US navy has deployed warships and a submarine to West Asia to bolster Israeli defences.One of the sources said Iran, along with allies such as Hezbollah, would launch a direct attack if the Gaza talks fail or it perceives Israel is dragging out negotiations. The sources did not say how long Iran would allow for talks to progress before responding. Amid the increased risk of a broader war, Iran has been involved in dialogue with Western nations on ways to calibrate retaliation, said the sources.
Article Summary: Only a ceasefire deal in Gaza stemming from hoped-for talks this week would hold Iran back from direct retaliation against Israel. Iran has vowed a severe response to Haniyeh's killing, which it blamed on Israel. Israel has neither confirmed or denied its involvement.

Article Title: Trump flies on jet previously owned by Jeffrey Epstein
Article Text: Donald Trump's prez campaign said Monday that it was unaware that a private plane used by Trump for campaign travel Saturday was once owned by Jeffrey Epstein , the disgraced financier and sex offender. Trump's signature Boeing 757 , often referred to as Trump Force One, experienced a mechanical issue en route to a rally in Bozeman on Friday.A Trump campaign official said the campaign had called its charter jet vendor, Private Jet Services Group, which provided the Gulfstream jet.He added that it would take efforts to avoid using that plane in the future.Epstein's planes have long been a source of public interest; he was known to travel with high-profile passengers, including ex-prez Bill Clinton, Trump, Prince Andrew and Robert F. Kennedy Jr, who is now running for prez as an independent candidate. Epstein also brought young women - and girls, according to some who accused Epstein of sex trafficking - to entertain guests on board.

Article Title: Former ISI chief Faiz Hameed arrested, court martial initiated: Pakistan army
Article Text:
'Allegations of serious nature,

would undermine reputation of gov

t, army'

How case unfolded

Former Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) chief Faiz Hameed was arrested by Pakistan military in connection to a housing scheme scandal and the process for his court martial was initiated, the army said on Monday.It is for the first time in the country's history that court martial has been initiated against a former intelligence chief, according to Dawn .“Complying with the orders of Supreme Court of Pakistan, a detailed court of inquiry, was undertaken by Pakistan Army, to ascertain correctness of complaints in Top City case made against Lt Gen Faiz Hameed (Retd),” a press statement by Pakistan army said further adding that "the process of Field General Court Martial has been initiated and Lt Gen Faiz Hameed (Retd) has been taken into military custody.”“Consequently, appropriate disciplinary action has been initiated against Lt Gen Faiz Hameed (Retd), under provisions of Pakistan Army Act,” the release further said.Hameed was regarded as close aide to Imran Khan, who appointed him to lead the ISI during his tenure as prime minister. Khan was removed from office in 2022 through a vote of no-confidence, which he claims was orchestrated by the military, though the military denies this allegation.In 2022, Hameed was one of the six senior-most generals whose names were forwarded by general headquarters to Pakistani prime minister Shehbaz Sharif for consideration for the two top military positions. He, however, chose to seek early retirement and submitted his resignation to the high command, as per sources.The Supreme Court, in its order dated November 14 last year, had said that the allegations against Hameed were of "extremely serious nature" and "would undermine the reputation of the federal government, the armed forces, ISI and Pakistan Rangers, therefore, they cannot be left unattended.”This came after the management of Top City, a private housing scheme, made allegations against the former spy-master, accusing him of orchestrating a raid on the offices and residence of its owner, Moeez Khan.The petition was filed on May 12, 2017, and it said that Pakistan Rangers and ISI officials conducted a raid on Top City's office and Moeez’s residence, seizing valuables such as gold and diamond jewelry and money in connection with an alleged terrorism case, Dawn reported.It also alleged the involvement of former ISI officials Irtaza Haroon, Sardar Najaf, Wasim Tabish, Zahid Mehmood Malik, and Mohammad Munir "in the illegal takeover of the housing society”.In March, a court placed retired naib tehsildar Najaf Hameed, Hameed's brother, under a 14-day judicial remand.Najaf and other co-accused had sought pre-arrest bail in an FIR filed with the Anti-Corruption Establishment (ACE) in Rawalpindi.The FIR alleged that former minister for mineral resources Hafiz Ammar Yasir had acquired properties worth billions of rupees through intermediaries.In April, the military had reportedly established an inquiry committee to investigate allegations of authority misuse involving the former ISI head.
Article Summary: Former Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) chief Faiz Hameed was arrested by Pakistan military in connection to a housing scheme scandal. The process for his court martial was initiated, the army said on Monday. It is for the first time in the country's history that court martial has been initiated against a former intelligence chief.

Article Title: 'Simply false': US denies role in Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina's ouster
Article Text: The White House has denied any involvement in the recent ousting of Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina , who stepped down and fled the country. Officials dismissed allegations of US interference on Monday, calling them "simply false.""We have had no involvement at all. Any reports or rumors that the United States government was involved in these events is simply false," White House spokesperson Jean-Pierre said during a press briefing when asked about the alleged US involvement.A report in the Economic Times on Sunday, stated, that Sheikh Hasina accused US of orchestrating her removal to gain control of Bangladesh's Saint Martin Island in the Bay of Bengal. According to the newspaper, Hasina allegedly communicated this claim through her close associates.Hasina's son, Sajeeb Wazed, countered these claims on X on Sunday, stating that his mother never made such allegations."We believe that the Bangladeshi people should determine the future of the Bangladeshi government and that's where we stand," the White House added.An interim government in Bangladesh, led by Nobel Peace laureate Muhammad Yunus , was sworn in last Thursday with the objective of overseeing elections in the nation.Recent demonstrations and violence in Bangladesh stemmed from student protests against government job quotas favoring certain groups.These protests escalated into a broader campaign to remove Sheikh Hasina from power.Hasina had secured a fourth consecutive term in January in an election that was boycotted by the opposition and deemed not free and fair by the US State Department.Following her resignation, Hasina traveled to New Delhi, concluding her 15-year run as Bangladesh's prime minister.
Article Summary: The White House has denied any involvement in the recent ousting of Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. Officials dismissed allegations of US interference on Monday, calling them "simply false" An interim government in Bangladesh, led by Nobel Peace laureate Muhammad Yunus, was sworn in last Thursday.

Article Title: US elections: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump to face off in prime-time debate on September 10
Article Text: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are set to meet in a highly anticipated prime-time debate on September 10, as announced by ABC News on Thursday. This 90-minute showdown, expected to be held in Philadelphia, marks a pivotal moment in an unpredictable presidential campaign that has already seen significant twists and turns.The debate will be moderated by ABC anchors David Muir and Linsey Davis. Although the exact format and ground rules are still being finalized, it is likely that the event will proceed without a live audience, according to sources familiar with the plans.Notably, Trump had proposed three debates with major networks - September 4 with Fox News, September 10 with NBC, and September 25 with ABC. However, Harris has agreed to participate only in the September 10 debate with NBC. Harris has not yet provided reasons for declining the other proposed dates.This announcement follows Trump's initial agreement to debate President Joe Biden on the same date, an arrangement made months ago. However, after Biden's unexpected withdrawal from the race, Trump questioned the validity of that commitment with Harris, leading to uncertainty over whether the debate would take place.Recent events, including Biden's exit and an assassination attempt on Trump, have drawn renewed attention to the presidential race, which had initially been shaping up as a repeat of the 2020 election. The upcoming ABC debate is expected to serve as a critical moment in the campaign's final stretch leading up to the election.Trump has also indicated his willingness to engage in additional debates with Harris, proposing events hosted by NBC News and Fox News. However, the Harris campaign has not yet agreed to these additional debates. NBC News is reportedly in discussions with both campaigns about a potential debate on September 25, but Harris has not committed to participating. Similarly, no agreement has been reached for a debate hosted by Fox News.
Article Summary: The debate will be moderated by ABC anchors David Muir and Linsey Davis. Although the exact format and ground rules are still being finalized, it is likely that the event will proceed without a live audience. Trump had proposed three debates with major networks - September 4 with Fox News, September 10 with NBC, and September 25 with ABC. However, Harris has agreed to participate only in the September 10 debate with NBC.

Article Title: 'Cautionary tale for ... ': What Vivek Ramaswamy said on violence against Hindus in Bangladesh
Article Text: Vivek Ramaswamy , a former Republican presidential candidate, strongly denounced the targeted violence against Hindus in Bangladesh following the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina from office.In a post on X (formerly known as Twitter), Ramaswamy expressed his concern about the current situation, stating that "a quota conflict created to rectify the wrongs of rape and violence in 1971 is now leading to more rape and violence in 2024."Ramaswamy criticized the quota system implemented in Bangladesh after the country's bloody war for independence in 1971, which aimed to allocate jobs in the civil service based on specific social groups, such as war veterans, rape victims, and underrepresented residents."The targeted violence against Hindus in Bangladesh is wrong, it's concerning, and it's a cautionary tale for victimhood-laced quota systems," Ramaswamy said.He argued that the system proved to be a disaster, leading to protests in 2018 that temporarily scrapped most of the quotas. However, the quota system was reinstated this year, triggering further protests that ultimately led to the toppling of the government and the prime minister's exile.The former presidential candidate also highlighted the concerning trend of radicals targeting Hindu minorities amidst the chaos. He emphasized that "bloodshed is the endpoint of grievance and victimhood" and suggested that the United States should learn from the lessons unfolding in Bangladesh."Here's what happened: Bangladesh fought a bloody war for its independence in 1971. Hundreds of thousands of Bangladeshi civilians were raped and murdered. It was a tragedy, and it was rightly mourned. But in its aftermath, Bangladesh implemented a quota system for jobs in their civil service: 80% of the jobs were allocated to specific social groups (war veterans, rape victims, underrepresented residents, etc.), and only 20% were allocated based on merit," he said in a post on X."The quota system proved to be a disaster. In 2018, protests led Bangladesh to scrap most of the quotas, but the victim-patrons fought back…and the quota system was reinstated this year. That triggered more protests which toppled the government, and the prime minister fled. Once chaos begins, it can't easily be reined in. Radicals are now targeting Hindu minorities. A quota conflict created to rectify the wrongs of rape and violence in 1971 is now leading to more rape and violence in 2024. Bloodshed is the endpoint of grievance and victimhood. It's hard not to look at Bangladesh and wonder what lessons we would do well to learn right here at home," he added.Since the ousting of Sheikh Hasina's government on August 5, Bangladesh has been experiencing a volatile political situation. According to reports from two Hindu organizations in the country, the Bangladesh Hindu Buddhist Christian Unity Council and the Bangladesh Puja Udjapan Parishad, members of minority communities in Bangladesh have faced at least 205 incidents of attacks across 52 districts. As a result, thousands of Bangladeshi Hindus have been attempting to seek refuge in neighboring India to escape the ongoing violence.
Article Summary: Vivek Ramaswamy criticized the quota system implemented in Bangladesh after the country's bloody war for independence in 1971. He argued that the system proved to be a disaster, leading to protests in 2018 that temporarily scrapped most of the quotas. The quota system was reinstated this year, triggering further protests that ultimately led to the toppling of the government.

Article Title: Florida mother accidentally runs over daughter, child in critical condition
Article Text: A Florida woman mistakenly ran over her 12-year-old daughter on the first day of school , leading to severe injuries .The incident occurred on Monday at 7:54 am (US time) when the daughter got out of the car near Booker Middle School in Sarasota and dropped her school supplies on the ground. Not knowing that her daughter was picking up the stuff, mother pulled forward, according to the Daily Mail citing Florida Highway Patrol (FHP).Giving details about the incident, FHP spokesperson Kenneth Watson said, "Here we are, day one. We have already had a tragedy."“We are hoping that this does not happen again, but we have to remember to have that good spatial orientation when you are anywhere around the school zone and most certainly when you are letting your kids out of your vehicle,” Watson added.Watson further said that this incident could be avoided 100 percent if paid a little more attention.The girl was air-lifted to All Children’s Hospital and was in critical condition as of this report.Describing the horrific scene one of the witness said that she could not believe that joyous day could turn into tragedy.While another witness said, "She was just screaming, just in a panic, holding her head, holding her chest, crouching down, standing up, screaming again."After the incident, Booker Middle School principal Lashawn Frost sent a message, stating, "This serves as a reminder of the importance of following our established safety procedures.""Please remember that students should not be dropped off in the middle of Myrtle Street. This practice poses a significant risk to our students' safety and the safety of others on the road. We kindly ask that all parents and guardians follow the designated drop-off procedures by using the parent loop. This ensures that students enter the school safely and helps us maintain a secure environment for everyone," Daily Mail quoted Frost saying.
Article Summary: The incident occurred on Monday at 7:54 am (US time) when the daughter got out of the car near Booker Middle School in Sarasota. Not knowing that her daughter was picking up the stuff, mother pulled forward. The girl was air-lifted to All Children’s Hospital and was in critical condition.

Article Title: The University that made Kamala Harris
Article Text:
Origin:

Civil Rights movement

Political pull:

Illustrious alumni:

Many firsts:

Howard University Hospital:

Alpha Kappa Alpha:

When Kamala Harris announced her presidential campaign in 2019, she held a press conference at her alma mater Howard University to explain her decision. As one of the most prestigious historically black colleges and universities ( HBCU ), Howard has played a crucial role in shaping Harris' political outlook. Here's a look at Howard's history and influence in American academia and polity.Howard was founded in 1867 in Washington, DC, and named after General Oliver Otis Howard, head of the post-Civil War Freedmen's Bureau, who got the US Congress to appropriate funds for the school.The university is largely supported and funded by the American govt but is privately controlled. After being established, the university's main goal was to provide quality higher education for blacks, although it has always been open to students of any race and colour.Howard played a crucial role in the American civil rights movement. Alain Locke, chair of Howard's department of philosophy, authored the seminal work The New Negro (1925) - an anthology of essays and poetry on African-American art and literature - that helped spur the Harlem Renaissance. It was at Howard in the 1940s that students pioneered protest tactics like 'stool-sitting' where they would occupy stools in local cafeterias that denied service to African-Americans. The term " Black Power " is also believed to have been coined at Howard by Stokely Carmichael.Given Howard's influence in black polity and society, it has over the years attracted heavy-weight American politicians. Calvin Coolidge was the first sitting US prez to speak at Howard in 1924. In 1965, then president Lyndon B Johnson outlined his plans for civil rights legislation to the graduating class in Howard when the voting rights bill was still pending in the US Congress. All of this has made Howard the creme de la creme of HBCUs.Howard boasts of a long list of graduates who went on to achieve influential positions in education, society and governance. These include senator Edward William Brooke, playwright Amiri Baraka, Nobel laureates Ralph Bunche and Toni Morrison. Kamala Harris, on becoming vice-president, became the first Howard and HBCU graduate to hold the office.In 1975, Jeanne Sinkford became the first female dean of any American dental school when she was appointed as the dean of Howard University's school of dentistry.Previously known as Freedmen's Hospital, it has served the African-American community in the Washington metropolitan area since 1862. Howard University Hospital is the only teaching hospital located on the campus of an HBCU.The oldest black sorority of which Harris is a member, Alpha Kappa Alpha (AKA) was founded in 1908 at Howard as a support network for black women. AKA is also one of the 'Divine Nine' or the 'Pan-Hellenic Council' - the most powerful Black sororities in US. AKA is a huge force for Harris, having mobilised campaign funds and voters when Biden picked Harris as his VP nominee in 2020. It can be counted on to do the same this time for Harris's presidential bid.
Article Summary: Howard was founded in 1867 in Washington, DC, and named after General Oliver Otis Howard, head of the post-Civil War Freedmen's Bureau. Alain Locke, chair of Howard's department of philosophy, authored the seminal work The New Negro (1925) Students pioneered protest tactics like'stool-sitting' where they would occupy stools in local cafeterias.

Article Title: Kamala Harris Mcdonalds: Kamala Harris worked at McDonald's, can you picture Trump doing it: Tim Walz

Article Title: Joe Biden: Biden says he would attend Trump inauguration if he wins: 'I have good manners'
Article Text: President Joe Biden Tuesday said he would attend Donald Trump's inauguration in January in case the Republican presidential candidate wins this year's election. "I have good manners, not like him," Biden told reporters after being asked if he'd attend. Trump did not attend Biden's inauguration in 2021. It was the first time in over 150 years that the outgoing president skipped the new president's swearing in.Recently, Biden cleared the air about his opting out of the presidential race that he was so adamant to fight weeks ago. In an interview, Biden made it clear that some of his senior Democrat colleagues including Nancy Pelosi pressured him to step aside though he was not willing. He said he had no health issue and his fight with Trump was going neck and neck.On a question on how much more progressive Kamala Harris is than Biden, the president said Kamala is not more progressive than him on policy. “The issues we’ve worked on together have made big progress economically,” Biden said.“No one calls what we did on infrastructure progressive. It’s a good policy,” Biden added.In his interview with Elon Musk, Donald Trump Monday said removing Biden was a coup and Kamala Harris is as bad as Biden. Trump blamed Biden for Russia-Ukraine and Israel crisis and said a smart president could have stopped it. "But we had a man that actually made it more prevalent. It was so bad. The words he was using, the stupid threats coming from a stupid face that he was using. I said, this guy's gonna cause us a war. he's gonna cause this. And let me tell you, it can lead to World War III," Trump said.
Article Summary: "I have good manners, not like him," Biden told reporters after being asked if he'd attend. Trump did not attend Biden's inauguration in 2021. It was the first time in over 150 years that the outgoing president skipped the new president's swearing in.

Article Title: Barron Trump News: Is Barron Trump handling Donald's social media outreach team?

Article Title: Kamala Harris Polls: Nate Silver on what's working in favor of Kamala: 'Republicans saying she laughs a lot...'
Article Text:
'Kamala was well organized'

'Kamala Harris is fun'

Nate Silver , known for his accurate election prediction, updated his forecast and said the Democrats have more than doubled their chance of winning overnight. In an interview with the New York Times, Nate explained his updated forecast and said that it is really going well for Kamala Harris -- she is winning the election at around 52 per cent.Nate explained that Hillary Clinton was a "terrible" candidate but won the popular vote by two points."Is she (Kamala) a bit better than Hillary Clinton? Probably, right? So she can win by three of four? Well, if you win by three or four, then you win the Electoral College in most instances," Nate said.Counting the factors that worked well for Kamala Harris, Nate credited Kamala for being well-organized picking up fast from where Biden left. Nate said Kamala Harris was amazingly well organized at getting the entire establishment behind her within minutes of Biden announcing he was going to step down. Probably, Kamala had more support in the party than she let on, Nate explained.Nate weighed on another factor that Republicans denigrate Kamala Harris saying that she laughs a lot. But probably that's what the politics needs in a break from iits no-fun tone. "I think people in politics neglect just how annoying the pedantic, dramatic, no-fun tone of politics was. And if the worst Republicans can say about Kamala Harris is, oh, she laughs a lot — maybe it suits the mood after so many years of doom and gloom, so maybe it was just spontaneous and lucky," Nate said.
Article Summary: Nate Silver updated his forecast and said the Democrats have more than doubled their chance of winning overnight. Nate credited Kamala for being well-organized picking up fast from where Biden left. Nate weighed on another factor that Republicans denigrate Kamala Harris saying that she laughs a lot.
